title: Readout of Second Lady Karen Pence’s Remarks at Event to Honor Military Spouses – The White House
content:
Statements & Releases			
Issued on:
September 29, 2017
Today, Second Lady Karen Pence attended the annual Joint Military Spouses Conference in Honolulu, Hawaii. Mrs. Hollyanne Milley, wife of the Army’s Chief of Staff, General Mark Milley, accompanied Mrs. Pence to the conference. Upon arrival, Mrs. Pence and Mrs. Milley visited with military spouses and received an overview of the workshops taking place during the conference.After visiting the workshops, Mrs. Pence and Mrs. Milley attended the luncheon where the Second Lady delivered the keynote speech, focusing on this year’s conference theme, “Stronger Together.”During her remarks at the luncheon, Mrs. Pence said, “The strength of our nation doesn’t just come from the people in uniform who fight to protect our freedoms. The spouses and families, who serve alongside them, also make tremendous sacrifices to the greater benefit of our country.Military spouses are selfless heroes who work tirelessly to keep everything in order. Many of you have had to uproot your lives; give up your personal and professional aspirations and restart a career. I admire your steadfast devotion to your spouses and our nation.”To stay updated on Mrs. Pence’s events, follow her on Twitter at, @SecondLady.
